definition: soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
spoon/ladle/CL:把[ba3]/abbr. for 公勺[gong1 shao2], centiliter (unit of volume)

sentences.english: Place tablespoonfuls of mixture onto a baking paper lined tray. Flatten slightly with a floured fork.
sentences.chinese: 汤勺将混合勺满烤纸，叉将其稍微压扁。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in the heart cocotte over medium heat.
sentences.chinese: 同时，用中火和桃心铸铁锅加热另外一汤勺橄榄油。

sentences.english: His soup spoon dropped onto the ground.
We use spoons to eat pudding.
sentences.chinese: 用汤勺喝汤，而不用叉子。

sentences.english: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in medium skillet over medium-high heat.
sentences.chinese: 用中号煮锅开中火加热2汤勺橄榄油。

sentences.english: Spread 3 tablespoon cheesecake filling and a few strawberry slices on a cookie.
sentences.chinese: 将3汤勺的酪饼馅料和少许草莓片涂于饼干上。

sentences.english: Edgar says, "They were all born with silver spoons in their mouths."
sentences.chinese: 埃德加说，“他们一出生嘴里就含着金汤勺。”

sentences.english: Plaque attaches to teeth like jam sticks to a spoon. It can't be totally removed by rinsing, but a light brushing will do the trick.
sentences.chinese: 菌斑粘在牙齿上就想汤勺上的果酱，轻轻刷足以去除。

sentences.english: Smooth the mixture with the back of a soup spoon.
sentences.chinese: 用汤勺的背面把混合料抹平。

sentences.english: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in medium nonstick ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat.
sentences.chinese: 用中号不粘平底锅以中高火加热2汤勺橄榄油。

definition: spoon/ladle/CL:把[ba3]/abbr. for 公勺[gong1 shao2], centiliter (unit of volume)
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
wok with a long handle/wok spatula/ladle
